We provide them with school uniform, festival clothes and undergarments, Also providing hygiene kit

The amounts was spend to meet the daily expenses for running the balgruh which include providing children with lodging and Boarding facility. Children are given education and Vocational Training which include providing them with Textbook, Notebook, Stationary and other educational Materials. On regular basis, children counselling is been done by Visiting Counselor. Children medical treatment are also been looked after. Children are provided with Hygiene kit which include toothbrush,toothpaste

We have submitted the proposal to Women and Child Welfare Department, District Office in Thane, but we are yet to receive the grant sanctioned by them. To meet our daily expenses, Girivavasi Pragati Mandal Trust has provided us with resources. The resources includes providing children with hostel facility, giving them quality food, providing them with Education and Vocational Education which include Garments, Electrician, Agriculture, Warli Painting, Computer Software and Hardware knowledge.

Girivanvasi Pragati Mandal submitted the grant proposal to Women and Child Welfare office in Thane, but Palghar has been now given the status of New District. Due to which we have again submitted the proposal to District Women and Child Development office in Palghar, but the office was not settled and they were not having proper office and office staff, so our grant is still pending. To Run the Girivanvasi Pragati Mandal, the Somaiya Trust provided resources on daily basis to meet our expense

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shree Hanuman Vyayam Prasarak Mandal, Amravati is established in the year 1914 by a group of freedom fighters is now turn in to a social, non political, voluntary organization. It is managing institutions of physical education, Ayurvedic medicine, Engineering and Technology and courses in Information Technology. It is also managing the schools in tribal region for the up-lift the tribal and socially backward youths. The major activities of the Mandal include: 1. Farmers orientation programme in organic farming, new techniques in farming. 2. Training of sons of farmers in sports and physical activities. 3. Blood donation, Tree plantation, Traffic control etc. 4. Skill Development programme. 5. Pre recruitment police training programme. 6. Promoting Communal Harmony through sports programmes. 7 Propaganda of Indian traditional sports and culture at the national and international levels.
